alert.note: Alert for Harney (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 4:01PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Oregon, including the following county, Harney. * WHEN...Until 600 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 359 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is possible in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Burns, Hines, Crane, New Princeton, Lawen, Malheur Lake, Fort Harney, Wrights Point, Sand Hill and Circle Bar. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
